comments.body:
You need to open this against corefx.  You'll get the same issue with

```
[System.IO.Directory]::GetDirectories($path)
```

comments.author: rivy
comments.body:
@musm , I also agree that this is still a problem. A work-around is to use [DOS device path syntax](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats#dos-device-paths):

```shell
$p = $env:TEMP
$dir = "b"*255
$path = join-path $p $dir
mkdir "\\?\$path"
mkdir "\\?\$path\$dir\$dir"
```

Individual path segments still seem to be limited to 255 characters.

title: Long paths don't work properly
